---
title: "Instructors"
---

<br>
 
**Lisa Borre** Lisa is a Senior Research Specialist at the Cary Institute of Ecosystem Studies, and is the NALMS Region 3 Director. She is a co-liason for the NALMS Secchi Dip-In program, an active member in the Global Lake Ecological Observatory Network (GLEON), and Project Coordinator for the Lake Observer app.

<br>
 
**Sarah Burnett** is a PhD student at the University of Idaho, and the NALMS Student Director. Her research is focused on internal loading of phosphorus leading to algal blooms.

<br>
 
**Dana Stephens** has experiencing large databases, including North American Secchi data, and used various statistical analyses to examine temporal and spatial components of these data.

<br>
 
**Dan Stich** Assistant Professor in the Biology Department at SUNY Oneonta, where he teaches undergraduate and graduate courses in biometry, lake management, and ichthyology. He works extensively with R in research and teaching. He recently developed his first R package, <a  href="https://github.com/danStich/shadia"> shadia </a>, with collaborators.
